title: Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome protein (WASP) is a tumor suppressor in T cell lymphoma.
NPM-ALK phosphorylates WASp Y102 and contributes to oncogenesis of anaplastic large cell lymphoma.
T-cell receptor ligation causes Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome protein degradation and F-actin assembly downregulation.
Involvement of wiskott-aldrich syndrome protein in B-cell cytoplasmic tyrosine kinase pathway.
Evidence that the Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome protein may be involved in lymphoid cell signaling pathways.
